definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: Many women even prefer foreplay to actual sex and orgasm.
sentences.chinese: 相較於真實的性愛和高潮，很多女性更喜性前戲。

sentences.english: Foreplay is an essential part of great sex, but too often it is overlooked.
sentences.chinese: 前戲對於性愛很重要，但又往往被忽視。

sentences.english: Increasing foreplay time will lead to anticipation of the big event.
sentences.chinese: 增加前戲時間，會將你帶入絕美無倫的人間天堂。
所以別再讓前戲草草了事了。

sentences.english: But foreplay may come with a cost for males.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這種性前戲可能會使雄性付出一點代價。

sentences.english: Call it the insect version of foreplay.
sentences.chinese: 暫且稱之爲昆蟲式的性前戲吧。

sentences.english: Washing your partner’s body makes for awesome foreplay.
sentences.chinese: 洗你的搭檔的身體就是最棒的前戲。

sentences.english: So keep your pre- and post-coital repertoire free of these surefire screw-ups.
sentences.chinese: 所以請保證你在性愛的前戲和後戲中遠離下面的錯誤。

sentences.english: Did you notice this section is foreplay?
sentences.chinese: 你們有沒有注意到這一節演說是前戲？

sentences.english: Through foreplay, you need to get her wet before intercourse can take place.
sentences.chinese: 前戲結束之後，在交合之前，你應該讓她“溼”了。

sentences.english: After all, teasing is an essential part of foreplay.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，調笑是前戲必不可少的一部分。

sentences.english: Knowing the right techniques for foreplay can increase your sexual confidence.
sentences.chinese: 掌握正確的前戲技巧能提升你對性的信心。

sentences.english: Unless there are serious time constraints, foreplay should never be skipped.
sentences.chinese: 除非有嚴格的時間限制，前戲絕對不能跳過。

sentences.english: Teasing allows for greater energy awareness and arousal, and these are what make the experience ultimately so mind-blowing.
sentences.chinese: 充分的挑逗和前戲能讓後面的快感直衝大腦。

sentences.english: Foreplay before lovemaking is a boost up for many couples.
sentences.chinese: 前戲對於許多夫妻來說是一個“啓動”的過程。

sentences.english: And I'm also thrilled to be in the foreplay section.
sentences.chinese: 我也很開心被安排在“前戲”這一節。

definition: In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
carelessly and haphazardly/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
